documents.title: Beatrice <> Nikita Weekly 1:1 Notes
documents.content:
﻿Weekly notes

Dec 9, 2025

* should a C@C paid box ever have a status of cancelled in OWL

* Spur - use case: agent for competitive analysis flows

   * Received approval from Finance as a supplier

   * Dec 4, 2025

* PA interview process to be started

Dec 2, 2025

* GoC H1 2026 Product Prioritization - WIP

Oct 23, 2025

* Potentially Alison Ryan -- focus Shopify

* Payments C@C 

* How do we compensate for tactical-bias 

Oct 16, 2025

* 2026 OKRs and YP?

   * Shopify still on the table

* Actives DIY for OTP





Sep 18, 2025 | GoC: 2026 OKRs 

Attendees: Nikita Gorshkov Jama Musse Beatrice Dimarucut Deo Nathaniel





Notes

* First build Q1 KRs and from that make the initiatives 

* Customer-centric, smaller KRs which are not only business-focused

* How to connect our KRs with business OKRs (CVR, AOR → not customer metrics). Tying customer benefit into business value

* 3 KRs for Good Chop → could be some variations QoQ

* Should be framed in customer benefits

* Start from customer problem into business metrics

* Deadline: Next Wed









Sep 17, 2025

* Ranking experimentation capability for logged-out users 

* Charge at checkout

   * Our checkout layout using UPM; we’d need to define what parameters to send 

   * Migrating to UPL (“project lego”) - component-driven payment layout. UPM is still BE service. Would require building non-supported use cases (e.g. TB, cadences)

   * Ahmed doing investigation what’s cheaper; needs support from Alex.

Sep 3, 2025

* Payments AR

   * Sebastian involved

   * Stripe - nobody using them - more expensive. Payment platform allows you to plug in to your page to process payments. Provides everything Adyen provides.





Aug 28, 2025

* Ecommerce experience - potential alternative to explore vs. Shopify could be that we create separate menu where all SKUs are add ons which already enable item-based pricing. Question on whether this is more or less effort to integrate the orders from Shopify with our ops systems

* Legal checkbox

   * TPT approval of for only California

   * TPT doing it based on zip code, not State (since zip code is source of truth)

   * 3 SPs 





Aug 14, 2025

* PDP plan review Beatrice: Personal Development Plan 2025 <> Nikita;

   * What are the gaps we need to fill for a path to promotion?

Aug 1, 2025

* Creating pitch influencer marketplace mid-aug 





Jul 18, 2025

* Cancellation changes

   * If we must follow HF changes (?) then let’s just let them do it?

* 2WM timing

   * Deadline for wireframes and smoke test set up → late July / mid-August

      * Want to get it on the books for Q4

      * Speak to David 

   * More interest in occasion boxes

   * Want to keep 2WM work separate 

   * George has an idea on selling 3rd party boxes within HF → intersection with 2WM. Want to separate the domains more.









Jul 10, 2025

* 2WM

   * Prices should be comparatively similar

   * Pricing model

      * Similar to Wayfair - base price provided by 3rd party supplier 

      * They’re keeping inventory - they still own the items and logistics

      * We are just charging a margin on top to our customers

   * For SteerCo - need wireframes 

      * Could talk to David about it or do it myself / Stitch AI





Jul 1, 2025 

* 2-way marketplace: Secondary question on whether we hold inventory ourselves or not

* Main question is what is the assortment we would think is complementary to mealkits and our customer base. Main goal - reduce the trips our customer has to do to the store 

* Comp

   * Prep would start in September/October. Handed in Oc



reement from Yury to retain credits for customers

* Open topics

   * Is it easier to directly migrate to Cash Credits and for those with HelloCredits, and those with existing CC credits issued can be issued a voucher? 





Mar 7, 2025

* Consider Wunderkind in Design

* Wunderkind deprecation?

* Jay and Eric

   * Nikita to check in with Daniel

Feb 27, 2025 | Team 1:1s: Beatrice:Nikita (S/D)

Attendees: Nikita Gorshkov Beatrice Dimarucut

Attached files: Beatrice: Personal Development Plan 2025 





Notes

* Filtering / Sorting / Search research approach

   * Parallelize Design & Attributes research

* 2025 cumulative OKRs

   * Start listing out impact 

* TAM Expansion 2025 PA Requirements Gathering → break out for PA where support is needed in Q1 & Q2

* NV Decoupling

   * Reach out to Daniel Arias on resourcing 





Action items

* 















Feb 21, 2025 | Team 1:1s: Beatrice:Nikita (S/D)

Attendees: Nikita Gorshkov Beatrice Dimarucut

Attached files: Beatrice: Personal Development Plan 2025 





Notes

* Career Pathing plan

   * Filtering research method → preferable as interview but fine if not possible

   * Monetization strategies; led by Evan

      * Subscription-first

      * MOV

      * Marketplace play (more e-commerce, HF as online retailer) → testing more

      * HF mixed

   * Can co-validate some hypotheses with them

   * Big concern from Evan is no strong BC; WBD want for throughout March to April

   * OTP

      * Deliveries API - allows us to have multiple cadences in a more structured way + enabling endless pause by setting cadence to 0. To be used for X-selling

      * X-selling will also do OTP + sub for → August 

      * Note to Abdel / Adam - documentation for OTP

* Seamless





Action items

* Nikita to make introduction to IXI team on monetization strategies shadowing













Feb 6, 2025

Referrals / credits

* For business decision to just remove all credits from FY/L customers

   * Legal check

   * check on ext communication"

* Cancelled customers probably assume their credits got lost

* Is it easier to directly migrate to Cash Credits and for those with HelloCredits, and those with existing CC credits issued can be issued a voucher?

* What solution does Payments have to block/disable the HelloCredits?"

* What does CC do in these cases for a FL/Y customer not being able to access their credits

============================================================
## EMAIL CONTENTS
============================================================

----------------------------------------
### EMAIL: Notes: “Beatrice:Nikita 1:1” Dec 11, 2025
ID: 19b0cb41d3d85ba1
From: Gemini <gemini-notes@google.com>
----------------------------------------

Notes from “Beatrice:Nikita 1:1”



These notes have been sent to invited guests in your organization.



Open meeting notes



The content was auto-generated on December 11, 2025, 10:16 AM CET and may  

contain errors.





Summary



Beatrice Dimarucut and Nikita Gorshkov discussed HelloFresh's app-first  

approach for new features like merchandising tiles on Ellesium, clarifying  

that code reuse between web and mobile requires features to be built in a  

specific way, although all backend logic should be reusable. The  

participants addressed confusion around charge checkout issues and the  

cancel/refund functionalities during the AL migration, noting that  

performing one action makes the other option unavailable. Nikita Gorshkov  

suggested looping in Shay or creating documentation to clarify the charge  

checkout flows for AL, which Beatrice Dimarucut agreed is necessary for  

documenting expected AL behavior despite current workarounds with Bob.





Suggested next steps





Beatrice Dimarucut will ask about reusing the backend services for  

HelloFresh.



Nikita Gorshkov will create a document to loop in Shay and detail what Al  

is planning for charger checkout when it scales, given the confusion around  

current flows and issues.



Beatrice Dimarucut will document all charge checkout issues, including the  

difference in refund options via Al (orders tab vs. error reporting) and  

the necessary sequence of steps for pre-cut off orders.



Beatrice Dimarucut will conduct another live test and process it via Bob to  

understand the correct sequence of steps for pre-cut off orders.



Nikita Gorshkov will send Beatrice Dimarucut the sheet documenting the flow  

of order states, payment states, and Al actions.





Meeting records Document Notes by Gemini





Is the summary section in this email helpful?

Not Useful Email Useful Email





Google LLC, 1600 Ampitheatre Parkway, Mountain View, CA 94043, USA



You have received this email because meeting artifacts were initiated in  

Google Meet.








============================================================
END OF RAW DATA
============================================================

Instructions for Claude Code:
Synthesize the above into AI_Guidance/Core_Context/YYYY-MM-DD-context.md
IMPORTANT: STRICTLY IGNORE any content, meeting notes, decisions, or updates dated before 2025-06-14 (6 months ago).
Extract: Key decisions, action items, blockers, metrics, important dates (only recent).
Format: NGO-style bullets, structured sections
============================================================
## JIRA UPDATES (-12h)
============================================================

[GOC-3214] [Dashboard] Create graduation component (Status: Selected for Development, Priority: Normal)
[GOC-3215] [Dashboard] Graduation component logic (Status: Backlog, Priority: Normal)
[PA-25045] Update prospects-journeys model (Status: Backlog, Priority: Normal)
[PA-25587] MAC staging model schema change infer issue (Status: Done, Priority: Normal)
[PA-25046] Update mobile-steps-dashboard model (Status: Done, Priority: Normal)
[PA-25378] OTP impact on XBrand (Status: Done, Priority: Normal)
[PA-25472] Support W48-49 (Status: Done, Priority: Normal)
[PA-25529] setup foundations (Status: In Progress, Priority: Normal)
[PA-25542] SAR - IceKafee - Implement Timeliness Score (Status: In Review, Priority: Normal)
[PA-25263] SAR - Kakfa to S3 - Implement Timeliness Score (Status: In Review, Priority: Normal)
